column4: boboo... where can i find that compiz-fusion in 7.10? i've just upgraded from 7.04 but i can't find it.
check your xorg.conf, something is not enabled
ok... let me check on it.
check out the compiz-fusion website under troubleshooting

another question and i hope you can help me. our network has been modified for WPA-PSK TKIP... when the changed was implemented my machine became slow... when i open an apps, i normally get a 40 sec lag... apps don't open immediately.
sounds like a driver config problem, slowing down X
driver config problem? with the wireless? coz if i disable WPA-PSK TKIP everything goes back to normal... opening of apps is fast.
sorry, wireless I can not help
do you have any idea or any command line on how to check on it?
biggest problem with Linux is the answer is out ther.... it is trying to find it
sorry I'm dancing back and forth here Brasil GP pratice is on right now
